channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: From @WSJopinion: Nearly two years ago, I wrote in these pages, “I survived cancellation at Princeton.” I was wrong. Whoever you are and whatever your beliefs, this should terrify you, writes Joshua Katz https://t.co/uQUQaFhnDc

Shampoos and shower gels contain up to 95% water—and lots of other products are mostly water. Manufacturers, spurred in part by sustainability concerns, are removing the water in shampoos and lotions, and selling them as powders. https://t.co/CCVNaYkj8U
Here is an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal's weekend edition https://t.co/35nmrRU55w https://t.co/MVGyiCgBtd

From @WSJopinion: The next Republican president and GOP Congress should work to end the use of ESG principles nationwide. For the free market to thrive, it must be truly free, writes @Mike_Pence. https://t.co/5SaK0zcEZ2

Big Four accounting firm Ernst & Young is considering a world-wide split of its audit and advisory businesses, amid regulatory scrutiny of potential conflicts of interest in the profession, according to people familiar with the matter https://t.co/fMtyVKmntj
A financial revolution is gripping India—where even beggars take donations via apps https://t.co/UVoUZTySPn

As they moved from town to town fleeing the war in Ukraine, a mother calmed her son, a 19-year-old with Down syndrome, by telling him their constant movement had a purpose: to track down his hero, U.S. pro wrestler John Cena https://t.co/RWT6ldtW9t

National Rifle Association members at the group’s annual meeting Friday repeated their opposition to stronger gun-control measures as protesters outraged over the mass shooting at an elementary school four hours away said it was beyond time for action https://t.co/f8c9Vh16iJ
The Tampa Bay Rays and New York Yankees typically post baseball highlights on social media during games. On Thursday, they instead focused on gun violence. https://t.co/iVMIVdKIkd
Thousands of students at more than 200 schools in at least 34 states staged walkouts this week after the Texas shooting https://t.co/aL6aMxYWuN

Ukraine is accusing Russia of using thermobaric weapons—whose powerful blasts can unleash a devastating toll on people and buildings—in the latest battle for the Donbas area of eastern Ukraine https://t.co/Dm68davxAB
"Top Gun: Maverick" proved too pro-American for one Chinese investor, which backed out of the film amid mounting U.S.-China tensions https://t.co/TobzKnetx9

From @WSJopinion: “The inherent purpose of a gun is to kill. An item whose sole purpose is bloodshed does not deserve the protection of the Constitution,” writes Max Willner-Giwerc, a student at the University of Chicago Law School https://t.co/G5eRv3Ao79
The U.S. is expected to send long-range rocket systems to Ukraine that Kyiv says are necessary to fight Russia in the Donbas region, officials said https://t.co/ReXu4K11iM
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/LfVH1FW69X https://t.co/Uu5BzAodrE

Police responding to the Uvalde school shooting waited around an hour to enter the classroom where the gunman was because a commander on scene incorrectly thought no lives were at risk despite repeated 911 calls from inside the classroom, an official said https://t.co/R0Tmkloxve

With a rich payroll, savvy trades, value signings and unlikely draft picks, the Golden State Warriors found players who fit next to Stephen Curry—and got back to the NBA Finals https://t.co/qLVXxirtJK
President Biden’s Asian economic platform to counter China expanded to 14 founding members after Fiji agreed to join https://t.co/IrsATAbfl6
"Top Gun: Maverick" proved too pro-American for one Chinese investor, which backed out of the film amid mounting U.S.-China tensions https://t.co/95fpJ89WK7
Actor Kevin Spacey was charged with four counts of sexual assault against three men in the U.K., according to British prosecutors https://t.co/0wDeXeOC4y

Review: “Top Gun: Maverick” is half videogame, half car commercial, which may be exactly what audiences want from their big-screen experience now—frictionless storytelling with special effects. https://t.co/Fq43rJVnoY
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/NW1EXX0rSC https://t.co/jGqGhCJzRv
Since Russia invaded Ukraine, countries world-wide have enacted a wave of export curbs on food, a trend that economists say risks aggravating global food-price inflation https://t.co/L3NWpkiZWT
America's big-city populations dropped last year. Only two cities with more than a million people grew. https://t.co/Ef9oRVczlC
Iran accessed secret U.N. atomic agency reports almost two decades ago and sent them to top officials, who concealed suspected past work on nuclear weapons https://t.co/X9NxXrCl1t
For the first time, scientists have identified the entire genetic makeup of a victim of the deadly Mount Vesuvius eruption nearly 2,000 years ago https://t.co/7SnLGzWJ5p

The Russian economy is being battered by sanctions after its invasion of Ukraine, but the ruble is the best performer against the dollar this year. Here’s why. #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/kcpG1mwkGt https://t.co/EJ5L5BRkxQ
"Goodfellas" actor Ray Liotta died in his sleep while in the Dominican Republic, according to his publicist https://t.co/szNhCkcY46
Frantic parents urged police to enter Robb Elementary School in Uvalde as the attack was unfolding, videos on social media show: “Shoot him or something!” https://t.co/5JwxBAdqka

Kaitlyn Martinez, a fourth-grader at Robb Elementary, was playing with other kids during recess when the gunman first appeared on school grounds: “We all ran in and they told us to sit down and they turned off the lights and locked the door." https://t.co/WOIogryJEL
The Uvalde gunman fired shots outside the school for 12 minutes before walking in, Texas officials said, laying out a new timeline of the attack https://t.co/5iO0DYmf7L

“They are trying to cover something up,” said a neighbor who lives across from Robb Elementary and was confused why police didn’t immediately enter upon arrival. “I think the cops were waiting for backup because they didn’t want to go into the school.” https://t.co/5ISAwrTuFE

Senate Minority Leader Mitch McConnell threw his support behind bipartisan talks on legislation to address mass shootings, following the deaths of 19 children and two teachers at an elementary school in Uvalde, Texas https://t.co/cMwsY3gwqK
The Justice Department won’t charge FBI agents who disregarded Olympic gymnasts’ complaints of sexual assault by Larry Nassar and lied to cover their mistakes https://t.co/WkfaSxbI5a

Michigan election officials disqualified five Republican candidates vying to unseat Gov. Gretchen Whitmer this fall after an investigation found they had filed tens of thousands of forged signatures to get on the ballot https://t.co/4ZLqma1JQ0

“Abbott Elementary” star and creator Quinta Brunson is turning down requests from fans to make an episode about a school shooting, saying she believes it is misguided for entertainers rather than politicians to address gun violence https://t.co/Yh3g2KhHXk

The Palestinian Authority said an investigation concluded that an Israeli soldier deliberately shot and killed a Palestinian-American reporter covering an Israeli raid in the West Bank, a finding that Israel’s defense minister immediately denied https://t.co/vQvLUYkygX
“Goodfellas” actor Ray Liotta has died at 67 https://t.co/1CS5NhPpQo
The Uvalde gunman fired shots outside the school for 12 minutes before walking in, Texas officials said, laying out a new timeline of the attack https://t.co/9T4bZBv0i0

Frantic parents urged police to enter Robb Elementary School in Uvalde as the attack was unfolding, videos on social media show. Residents have questioned the time it took law enforcement to end the shooting. https://t.co/hR7YHGV7fI

A New York state appeals court ruled that former President Donald Trump and two of his adult children must testify under oath as part of the New York attorney general’s civil-fraud investigation into the Trump family business https://t.co/c0WZ7eTLfE
Actor Kevin Spacey was charged with four counts of sexual assault against three men in the U.K., according to British prosecutors https://t.co/CTtrmU0tmf
From @WSJopinion: Salvador Ramos, the Uvalde school shooter, was a troubled soul. But we are a disturbed society, writes Lance Morrow https://t.co/zKV5vePxzr

Senate Republicans are expected to block debate on a bill that would establish new domestic terrorism offices in the wake of a shooting that killed 10 Black people at a Buffalo, N.Y., supermarket https://t.co/mrmGn9RtOU

More than 1,000 people from Uvalde leaned into their faith as they gathered to listen to pastors offer messages of strength and salvation just 30 hours after a man shot and killed 19 children and two teachers in an elementary school https://t.co/4nyCfo7uL4
Broadcom agreed to buy software company VMware in a cash-and-stock deal valued at $61 billion, in what would be one of the year’s biggest deals https://t.co/U2OlsvsHxe
Uvalde, Texas, feels like the only topic worth talking about right now, writes sports columnist @JasonGay https://t.co/BSvZzegqgA

Texas Gov. Greg Abbott dismissed calls for more gun regulation following the mass shooting in Uvalde: “I hate to say this, but there are more people shot every weekend in Chicago than there are in schools in Texas." https://t.co/WPuECvv2fX
New York lost hundreds of thousands of people during the year that ended July 1, 2021, as it and other big U.S. cities saw residents flee for more space and cheaper housing https://t.co/NEQHKyd4Zs

Russian Orthodox Church leader Patriarch Kirill has been a key Putin ally, promoting the view of a "holy struggle against the West" to millions of faithful. The EU is considering sanctioning him. https://t.co/FXI3OyychC
